macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Closes Slightly Lower at 6896 on December 30
items.summary: The S&P 500 ended down 9 points at 6896 on low volume of 3.3 billion shares, with 53% of intraday volume traded higher but 51% of stocks closing lower, signaling a neutral to lower outlook.

items.title: Indian Markets Open Higher on December 31
items.summary: Nifty 50 opened up 0.12% at 25,971.05 and Sensex up 0.14% in pre-opening; previous day Nifty 50 closed down 0.01%.

items.title: S&P 500 Technical Outlook Bullish with Pivot at 6,859.63
items.summary: US500 (S&P 500) shows bullish momentum, potential short-term pullback to pivot at 6,859.63 before rising, supported by 38.2% Fibonacci retracement.

items.title: US Dollar Index Bearish on December 31
items.summary: DXY exhibits bearish direction and overall bearish momentum in technical review.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Stabilizes Around $90,000 After October Peak of $126,000
items.summary: Bitcoin is stabilizing at approximately $90,000 following a high of $126,000 in October 2025, with total market capitalization at $3 trillion despite recent sell-offs. Institutional investors have accumulated over $95 billion in Bitcoin.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Extended Correction with Hash Rate Decline Signaling Potential Bottom
items.summary: Bitcoin's price has dropped to around $88,000-$90,000 amid a 4% hash rate decline in December 2025, historically preceding rebounds, while long-term holders sold over 80,000 BTC. Analysts watch $74,000 as critical support.

items.title: Crypto Trading Volumes Plunge to 2025 Lows During Holiday Slump
items.summary: Cryptocurrency markets experience a holiday slump with trading volumes at the lowest levels of 2025, altcoins like ETH and SOL seeing over 50% weekly volume drops compared to last year.

items.title: Ethereum Trades Around $3,000 with Upcoming 'Hegota' Upgrade Anticipated
items.summary: Ethereum is stabilizing near $3,000 after corrections, remaining key for DeFi and NFTs, with a major scalability upgrade 'Hegota' expected by end of 2026.

items.title: Altcoins Show Mixed Performance with CHZ, AT, and CYBER Leading Gains
items.summary: Major cryptocurrencies trade mixed on December 31, 2025, with outperformers CHZ up 19%, AT up 17%, and CYBER up 16%, amid moderate growth in top altcoins.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: U.S. Army Launches Dedicated AI and Machine Learning Career Field for Officers
items.summary: The Army announced a new 49B specialty for officers, opening in January 2026 via Voluntary Transfer Incentive Program, to develop leaders advancing AI-enabled transformation in decision-making, targeting, logistics, and robotics.

items.title: Luxbit.ai Completes Internal AI System Architecture Upgrade
items.summary: Luxbit.ai confirmed the full deployment of an internal upgrade to its AI system, involving changes to architecture, processing workflows, and infrastructure, with no user disruptions and alignment to operational standards.

items.title: Threat Actors Promote AI-Enhanced Metamorphic Crypter on Dark Web
items.summary: ImpactSolutions is marketing InternalWhisper x ImpactSolutions, an AI-powered metamorphic crypter using machine learning to rewrite its codebase per build, evading antivirus via in-memory execution and advanced obfuscation techniques.

items.title: OpenAI Acknowledges Persistent Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in AI Agents
items.summary: AI agents remain susceptible to prompt injection attacks, particularly on the open web, highlighting ongoing security challenges despite advancements.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Spacestation Gaming, ENVY, and NTMR Disband The Finals Rosters
items.summary: Several esports organizations including Spacestation Gaming, ENVY, and NTMR have disbanded their rosters for the tactical FPS game The Finals ahead of the 2026 competitive season.

items.title: Monolith Studio Closes, Ending Nemesis System Development
items.summary: Monolith, creators of the Nemesis system from the Shadow of Mordor series, has shut down, marking a significant loss for innovative gaming mechanics despite licensing until 2036.

items.title: Arc Raiders Launches with AI-Generated NPC Voices
items.summary: Arc Raiders has implemented AI for NPC voices, sparking discussions on its acceptability in entertainment despite impacts on voice actors in the industry.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
